Well. That was amazing. And my love for cake is now even stronger.

2007 год именно тогда вышел уже знаменитый Orange Box от Valve в которую входили Half-Life 2: Episode Two», «Team Fortress 2» и «Portal»

Халфа 2 из оранжевой коробки завершала историю, Тим фортресс 2 подсадил кучу народа подманив выпадающими шмотками, а Портал был первой частью и на фоне других в коробке был самым оригинальным из всех игр Valve.

Играем мы против искуственного интеллекта который создаёт для нас испытания, проходя комнату за комнатой мы движемся к своему "спасению") Чем дальше тем сложнее испытания.

Сюжет наполнен чёрным юмором поэтому скучности нет, так же как и нет чуства безысходности всё сделано по домашнему уютно)) 

То самое время когда Valve ещё делала произведения искусства, играть обязательно!

Natural science is the study of the nature of portals of human life there is no co-operative in the 2nd part of the difficulty here but higher than in the 2nd part where I tell speediness skill and cleverness as I think it is worthy of 5/10 cakes!

The award winning game [b][i]Portal[/i][/b]. It's really worth playing it! I personally took a while to figure out some of the puzzles... but they aren't really difficult. Maybe the workshop got some community made masterpieces for this game :)

I doubt that the chambers have any replay value. Once you've figured out how to solve it, it pretty much stays in your brain... so there's no surprise effect.

But maybe you're that type of player who likes to beat their own time-score? It can be fun!

A combination of 3D platformer and puzzle game, Portal explores the concept of a teleportation gun by having the player test it out in a series of lab evaluations. It soon becomes clear, however, that everything is not as it seems at Aperture Science Labs and the tests eventually take a very dark turn. Innovative gameplay is a huge highlight and the passive-aggresive banter of AI guide GLaDOS gets exceedingly more amusing as the game wears on. The game is fairly short, offering 3-4 hours of gameplay, but the environments and music are captivating enough to want to play through it multiple times. This game is a strong recommendation for fans of Valve's other games or anyone just looking for something refreshingly different.

Davvero un must

Portal is probably the most creative singleplayer game of all time. It's so much fun to play, and the humor is brilliant. It starts off easy, and the difficulty progression is casual. My first experience with Portal was with Portal 2 on the XBox 360, and it was an enjoyable experience. I purchased this game on Steam during last year's Summer Sale as part of the Valve Complete Pack at an awesome price. The gameplay is brilliant, the level design is superb, and the two characters are well crafted, Chell (yourself), and GLaDOS. There is never a dull moment in this game, and the replay value is extraordinary. My only complaint with this game is it only has about 3 hours of main story content, which feels kind of lacking. But this game deserves to be owned by everyone on Steam. Definitely pick up this game and the sequel when you have the chance.
39 Triangles/42 Triangles

This game is the grandfather of all puzzle game (and no, candy crush is NOT a puzzle game.) Although it does leave you with a slightly short storyline, anyone who would want to play even more can check out portal 2 (This game wont let you down)

Portal is timeless. With it's realistic but smooth graphics and fun gameplay portal is well worth the $10 you pay for it. I am not much of a puzzle gamer but this game is a convention breaking gem. I love story based anything and this game has my favorite kind of story- one that takes some effort to uncover. Portal also contains one of my favorite video game villains of all time- GlAdOs. She is both hillarious and a boss. 

So, play portal!

If you haven't played this, congratulations on discovering video games 30 years late.

10000/10.

Шедевр!
Новый игровой механизм и интересная личность главного врага. Всё это на фоне минималистического дизайна туров.
Игра в стиле головоломки с новым механизмом прохождения - порталы.
Игра сосредоточена на выживании главной героини с помощью эксперементального инструмена, способного образовывать порталы в стенах, на потолках и на полу. Всё идёт по плану главного компьютера, который руководит главной героиней до определённого момента. История, как это любит делать Valve в предыдущих играх Half Life, частично повествуется общими картинами и недоговорками. Эта часть истории отрывочна и загадочна. Главная героиня безмолвна.
Единственный недостаток игры, что она очень короткая. А также головоломки относительно простые.
Что игру выделяет, кроме самой системы порталов, так это личность компьютера.
A true Masterpiece, Portal is the closest thing to mechanical perfection I've ever seen,
Juegazo, excelente mecanica una muy buena historia para ser tan breve, que te deja intrigado, muy buenos retos  y mucho ingenio para realizarlos. Se recomienda ampliamente

Portal was a very fun game.  Puzzles were good, story was interesting and funny, the game was worth playing just to hear the song at the end.  It is very fun and funny game.  The only negative I might say about the game was that I wish it was a bit longer.  Mind you, I did also play Portal 2 and that was a lot longer, and it was very nice playing both games back to back, so I definitely got my monies worth with the two games.  Plus there are a whole lot of user created levels to play as well.  I have not played any multiplayer games yet, but I might give that a try too.  I really liked the Portal series.

muito engraçado como esses portais te levam de um lugar a outro. Aqui na minha cidade existe algo parecido que se chama bonde. Nao é aquele bonde que vc tem na sua escola ou na rua. É um bonde diferente e especial que te leva de um lugar ao outro com eficiencia e agilidez. Nao sei porque as pessoas nao aproveitam esse meio de transporte magico e maravilhoso. Portal is probably one of the best games I have played. Its graphics gives you a good feeling of what it is, and with the power of the Source gravity engines, it gives the game difficulty and wit. I admit it is only 2-3 hours long, but I played it, and found the most disturbing secrets ever. Half life 3 was confirmed in this review.
Excellent puzzle game, definitely recommended!
portal is awesome

Portal is a puzzle game that requires efficient thinking and sometimes quick reflexes. It follows a decent story and each puzzle is very rewarding when you complete it. If you can figure things out quickly, it's about a 5 hour game. However, it's a very decent and entertaining game, and sets the stage for Portal 2, an incredible advance for the series. My suggestion? Buy the Portal bundle, play both games, and enjoy the thrilling ride of the Portal series.
10/10 would die again

This game is great! The story is cool, with the Rat Dens by Doug Rattman, and the story of how GLaDOS killed everyone in Aperture Labs. The tests are puzzeling, and expand your mind, and make you think with Portals. The final boss fight timed was a bit hard, because of the timer, but overall, it was a great game! It was short, making it good to speedrun. I've played the campaign about 4 times, once in 6 hours, once in like 3 hours, once in 50mins and once in like 30mins. So, great story and good graphics, plus portals, which are awesome! But, The Cake is a Lie. Overall, 10/10 would buy again.

Excellent game. Shouldn't be too challenging to anyone who likes solving puzzles. I was disappointed by the short length of the main story but it ended before it got old, so there's that. The final battle was probably the most entertaining boss-fight of my gaming life.

Recommended for anyone who enjoys puzzles in their games or anyone fairly new to gaming (right after Half Life). But everyone should give it a shot.
Insert "the cake is a lie" cliché.

Short, yet amazing. Valve's crack team delivered with Portal. The game mechanic was brilliantly executed, the puzzles had a great difficulty curve, and were very satisfying to complete, and GLaDOS' sociopathic wit absolutely sold it. My only complaint is that it was so short, and now we have Portal 2 with community levels, so there goes that complaint forever.
It's frickin' Portal. It's great and one of my favourite games of all time.
